name: rclone
description: Rclone is a command-line program for syncing files and directories to cloud storage providers. It supports encryption, mounting, and advanced operations with a powerful CLI.
features: Multi-cloud support: Sync files across 40+ cloud storage providers including S3, Google Drive, and Dropbox.
Encryption: Protect data with client-side encryption before uploading to cloud storage.
Mount functionality: Access cloud storage as a local filesystem using FUSE on Linux and macOS.
Bandwidth control: Limit upload and download speeds to avoid saturating your network connection.
Sync operations: Keep local and remote directories synchronized with bidirectional or one-way sync.
Deduplication: Identify and skip duplicate files to save bandwidth and storage space.
Checksum verification: Ensure file integrity by comparing checksums after transfers.
Filtering rules: Include or exclude files based on patterns, size, or modification time.
Progress tracking: Monitor transfer speed, remaining time, and file counts during operations.
Retry logic: Automatically resume failed transfers and handle temporary network issues.
Crypt backend: Create encrypted remotes that work with any supported cloud provider.
Web GUI: Manage transfers and browse remote storage through an optional browser interface.
